title: Christine McGuinness braves the October weather in plunging mini dress
text:
Hope she doesn’t catch a cold! (Picture: Getty Images)

Christine McGuinness is known for her love of a risque outfit and it was no different on Tuesday as she rocked a satin mini dress with a plunging neckline.

And all despite the bitter October UK weather.

The reality TV star was a guest at the Best Heroes Awards 2019 and was joined by pals including restauranteur Aldo Zilli for the charity gala that saw recognises the UK’s most deserving heroes for their exceptional courage and bravery.

The wife of comedian Paddy McGuinness looked stunning in the figure-hugging teal green corset dress which featured long sleeves and a tie detail at the chest.

Accessorising with gold stilettos and handbag, the Real Housewives Of Cheshire star showed off her amazing figure with a smile on her face

Her appearance comes two days after she also wowed fans in a stunning see-through dress (Picture: Splash)

Her appearance comes two days after she also wowed fans in a stunning see-through dress at Manchester Fashion Festival on Saturday night.

With the dress’ intricately embroidered panels covering her modesty, the 31-year-old went jewellery free and let her gown do the talking while carrying a silver Yves Saint Laurent bag.

Aldo Zilli helped Christine out of the ceremony (Picture: GC Images)

The mother-of-three, who is married to TV presenter and comedian Paddy McGuinness, is never one to shy away from an OTT outfit, recently sporting a pink PVC look as Bondage Barbie for a fancy dress party.

Subtle.

Christine is never one to shy away from a look (Picture: Backgrid)

Over the years, the model has struggled with her body image and has spoken openly about the toll eating disorders had on her mental and physical health.

‘I had anorexia for over 10 years as a child, all through my teenage years, [and was getting better] when I met my husband aged 19, 20,’ she told Giovanna Fletcher’s Happy Mum Happy Baby Live podcast.

‘It was that strive and I just really wanted to be a mum that made me get over that,’ she continued. ‘When I went to see a doctor the reason I wasn’t ovulating or having my periods was down to having an eating disorder.

‘That made me get better but it took four years for everything to regulate.’
description: Paddy McGuinness' wife was a guest at the Best Heroes Awards 2019.
